Reviews.Title: “What a Great Deal Near Disney/Sea World”
Reviews.Author: Sherry R
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect location near all the Orlando attractions. We drove to downtown Disney, all the Disney Parks, Sea World, all in about 10 minutes. The property was clean, quiet at night, near a lot of restaurants, and the staff was very helpful. It also has a nice pool, and plenty of parking. I highly recommend it for an Orlando stay. The complimentary breakfast was great, and the space was adequate so that it was not crowded. It also offers shuttles to the parks, but we chose to drive ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Below Expectations, but working to improve.”
Reviews.Author: Tim G
Reviews.Content: I travel on business and Hampton Inns are one of my company's preferred hotels. However, I found the this particular Hampton Inn to be subpar with my expectations. During this stay, the hotel was busy, with 2 high school bands staying there. However, since this is what they do (provide a place to stay for many people at one time), I would not expect this to be a problem for them. After our first day at Universal Studios, we returned to our room to find that our room keycards did not work. After getting our keycards reactivated, we found that our room had not received any housekeeping (and we had NOT hung the Do Not Disturb sign on the door). Our beds were not made and we had no clean towels. The gentlemen at the front desk (didn't get his name, as it was late and I was tired) only apologized, gave me some towels, and said it had been a busy day. After our second day and third days, we had clean towels, but our beds were never made up. The only redeeming factor from this stay ocurred upon checkout when person on duty (Justin) asked about our stay. When I told him it was not up to my expectation for a Hampton Inn and gave him the details, he immediately credited my account for 1 night's stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelgirlmsp
Reviews.Content: This was the fourth hotel we stayed in on our Florida journey and I found it to be pretty average compared to the others. Rooms were clean, staff was friendly, breakfast was good, but the hotel itself felt a little worn around the edges. However, considering all the traffic that goes through the hotels in Orlando, I guess "worn around the edges" is something one has to expect. I wouldn't disregard this as a place to stay next year.

Reviews.Title: “Never book a reservation”
Reviews.Author: Judy W
Reviews.Content: During spring break, an obviously busy time in Orlando, the Hampton overbooked. We called the night before to confirm our reservation, only to show up at dinner time, to find out they could not give us a room due to over booking. In order to "compensate" us, the Hampton sent us ten miles away to a complete dump that we felt very uncomfortable staying at. Had they told us when we called to confirm our reservation, that they had overbooked, we could have made alternative arrangements. As it was spring break, we could not find another room in Orlando and believe me we tried. Let the person reserving a room do at his or her own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Stay”
Reviews.Author: Chuck2010
Reviews.Content: You can count on the Hampton for great service and a clean comfortable room. Our corner king room was spacious and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Waiting to hear back on left-behind item”
Reviews.Author: Paula M
Reviews.Content: Daughter checked out Monday and left her black winter jacket in closet in room. She made a few phone calls to front desk and housekeeping and no one has returned her calls. Frustrating! I called just now and hope to receive some assistance.

Reviews.Title: “You'll need a rental car”
Reviews.Author: AkamaiLynn
Reviews.Content: Free shuttle to Dworld was not worth it. The pickup time is later in the morning than preferred and the available pickup times at the parks are not convenient. One night we took a taxi back from a park to avoid waiting 2+ hours for the hotels' shuttle bus. If you need to do shopping you will end up walking about a mile one way to a store. The nearest restaurant outside of the hotel is a Burger King. I know because after having the front desk call a taxi for me, I waited over 45 minutes and when the taxi had not arrived, I walked instead. Never again. The room was outdated and the sofabed was very poor quality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Randy H
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, with friendly professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “The bathroom was dirty and hairy”
Reviews.Author: angelina F
Reviews.Content: First of all I am a picky person. This is the second time I stayed in this hotel. The first time was incredible. I loved it so much I went back to book this hotel but this time the tub was very dirty. Was stained and I found some hairs in the tub. I reserve the room with two beds. I was very disappointed with this hotel. Good luck with the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Orlando Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mary Ann C
Reviews.Content: Booked Hampton to see granddaughter in National Dance Competition at Disney's ESPN Sports. Hotel is convenient to Disney but away from the crazy Disney traffic pattern. Suite was very clean and well appointed with king size bed, HD TV, large sitting area, mini kitchen, and desk with internet access. Breakfasts were hot, very adequate, and convenient before setting off for Disney. All staf that we interacted with were both friendly and informative. My husband and I were extremely pleased with our decision to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price, Super Staff”
Reviews.Author: PEI_Travellers
Reviews.Content: Hotel was full for each of the 8 nights we stayed there, but you would hardly know it, very quiet. Room was spotless and beds were super comfy. Location is great near major restaurants, outlet mall, walmart and attractions. Lots of breakfast options included with your night's stay. Staff were very friendly and courteous and went above and beyond on several occassions. I have always stayed at Hamptons for work and this was my first extended stay for a family vacation and we were not disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bwvmommy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel one night, before a cruise. It is convenient and very well kept. They serve the regular Hampton Breakfast, with a little Mickey Mouse twist! The kids loved it. Our room was very clean, and the bathrooms are a great size for the family. The pool wasn't anything fancy, but did the trick. Also very clean. I would defininately stay here again when in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “EH, You could do much better in the same area”
Reviews.Author: LetsgoFtLaud
Reviews.Content: Ok, First the positive. I am an HHonors member so I am loyal to the Hilton Brand. I have stayed at Hiltons and Hampton Inns in the Orlando Area. This hotel is in a good location. Close to Disney and all the Theme park stuiff. Lobby was nice and staff was neither super nice nor rude. They were who they were and I cannot say anything bad about them. Not wowed either way. Restaurants are close by. We did not go to any but they were there. The best thing about this hotel I thought was the little fitness center they had. The treadmill worked and that was all i could ask for. The TV in the room got lots of channels and had good reception. that was a big plus Now for the eh. The room was eh. Not dirty but not spotless. It was definitely of an older style and even the hallways looked a tad bit rundown. This may not matter to some but I like my carpet to be clean looking and I hated the drab green colored couches. room had a fridge and microwave that was nice. Bathroom was clean but some dirt buildup was in the corners. No big deal. Shower was powerfull and I liked that also. The breakfast was just eh. Eggs were watery. Not runny but kind of tasted watery. Not much choice either. Fruit looked kind of old and bananas were brown. If hotel reads this I am sorry but this is all true. I have stayed in other Hamptons in Orlando that were of a much higher standard. I would not stay here again. For a little more money I would stay at a much newer one or even the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great location........”
Reviews.Author: bus71
Reviews.Content: Great location for visiting all attractions. Lots of restaurants & shopping nearby. Cracker Barrel, Smokey Bones, Bob Evans, Taco Bell, McDonalds, Target, WalMart, Outlet shopping etc. The hotel was nice. Nice small pool area w/ hot tub. Big b'fast area. Good selection. Bagel Toppers & Eggs, Eggs w/ham & cheese & sausage, Bagel Toppers & Sausage along with the usual, waffles, fruit, toast, juice (which was room temp.) cereal etc. The breakfast staff was very riendly and the food was always stocked. There was a security guard in the lobby one night which we thought was a little strange. Were we in a bad part of town?? We asked at the front desk and we were told that when a large group was staying at the hotel they had a security guard......WIERD! There were 2 computers in the lobby but only 1 worked. There was a rude and very loud maint. worker in the lobby late one night giving the front desk gal a hard time. The bed was pretty comfy but it didn't seem like the usual "hampton" bed. After sleeping on it for 7 straight nights we were glad to move on. The wireless internet was slow....a little faster when you plugged into the "hard wire". Would stay here again if the price was right but would also look at other options.

Reviews.Title: “Attention Thiefs!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cdegalvis
Reviews.Content: I've just stayed for 4 nigths (January 7th-January 11th 2012) in this hotel. Everything was just Ok a regular Hampton Inn. Spacious room, somewhat clean, good price, good location, heated pool, just great for an after cruise stay BUT right the day we left we were stolen from our suitcases a brand new Iphone, Ipod, 2 cell phones and a Rolex watch. Taken from inside our suitcases they went and dig them very well. This was the most unbelieveble thing that has ever happened to us in a hotel!!! and boy we travel! If you choose to stay there...Please lock up your bags otherwise you will be missing your stuff!

Reviews.Title: “Soccer Tournament Else Would Not Stay”
Reviews.Author: sushicrazy
Reviews.Content: Paid $131(plus taxes) per night and got double bedded room next to elevator, awake all night(rate adjusted per complaint). Changed rooms to King bed and sofa roll-out next day, much better room but not very clean especially bathroom (see pic for major mold across bottom of shower door, entire frame needs good scrub down). Both rooms had lights out, but I guess unless previous customer reports it, it goes unnoticed. Breakfast was ok for kids but a bit non appetizing for adults. Never liked eating on paper with plastic. Need some healthy food, (at least cut the oatmeal to plain, let customers add the sugar). Stay was acceptable but not a hotel we would book on our own. Normal room rate is $80-$90, and $131 for a room (even the larger suite) there during a soccer tournament is overpriced. Did get adjustment to first night rate due to being put in wrong type of room next to elevator. In fairness, we are spoiled by 4 & 5 star resorts/hotels so may have a different perspective. Also the front desk was responsive, just not to our liking.

Reviews.Title: “Good situation”
Reviews.Author: ClareColwynBay
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to from the airport about 20 minutes easy driving and when you get there you have lots of restaurants nearby on 192. Disney is easy to get to and takes about ten minutes. Walmart just up the road. Hotel clean and rooms were comfortable. Staff very helpful. I had a problem contacting a friend in Fort Lauderdale and they sorted me out with a smile. Breakfast was good -I thought very good until we went to the Hampton in Fort Lauderdale the next day and it was better. Pool was good - warm and clean as was the surrounds. LOts of car parking space. Will definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable time in a good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyMac100
Reviews.Content: Friendly, professional staff in a clean well appointed hotel made this trip a pleasure. good breakfast display, plentiful food but get there early. Will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: Richardsontraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel and room were clean. Close drive to Disney parks. Free coffee and tea all day in breakfast area. Parking was free and ample. Only drawbacks: Disney ticket area was setup, but there was no one there to sell tickets the day we wanted to buy them. Breakfast area utensils were not available sometimes, understandable with huge crowds at breakfast. (Its free so can't complain).

Reviews.Title: “A great place in Kissimmee - also for smokers!”
Reviews.Author: DanishMartin
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel, many times over the last two years. It has become my favorite place when I visit my friends in Orlando. Staff is always friendly, rooms are spacious, free WiFi and breakfast - close to both all the amusements, close to Outlet shopping and close to Orlando. It's ideal - atleast for me. There is very few hotels in the Orlando where you are allowed to smoke - here you can order a smoking room, rooms doesn't particularly smell of smoke, and everything in and around the hotel is nice and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Cricket33
Reviews.Content: This Hampton Inn & Suites was very relaxing and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The location is a touch remote as mainly destinations in Orlando / Kissimmee are far apart from one another, so a key recommendation when visiting is to rent a car! This is especially true for your trip to and from the airport (as much as $50-$65 each way depending on which company you use). Disney is very close (about a 10 minute car ride) while Universal Studios is a little farther (about 25 minutes). Although the sun does not hit the pool area during the hours one would be lounging at the hotel, having the Jacuzzi to soak in after a day of walking was wonderful (and being outside in the Florida weather is a plus). The complimentary morning breakfast was also a treat in that there are some hot options (make your own waffles and some sausage and scrambled eggs) as well as cold (Danishes, cereals, bread etc...). Otherwise, great locations nearby for breakfast (Bob Evans) & lunch / dinner (TGI Fridays & Smokey Bones) provided us with some variety that was within walking distance. In your room, having a decent sized fridge and microwave was also great to have for those off hours drinks and snacks J Overall a nice reliable, and comfortable place to rest our heads at the end of long adventurous days in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kj H
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, nice location for access to the theme parks and other area attractions. Staff was friendly. We found a Sports/Ultra Lounge just down the way Pafos Ultra Lounge and the manager there, Mario was wonderful! This property is definetly one I would stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Honest Choice”
Reviews.Author: Aussietez
Reviews.Content: This is the type of hotel you will probably forget not too long after your trip, not because it was bad or because it had something particularly memorable to remember, but because it is an unpretentious hotel that does the simple things well. It doesn't have a grand entrance foyer or resort style facilities, but it does have modest and very clean rooms with friendly service at a reasonable price. We paid $317 for 3 nights in a 2 queen room for a family of 4 and that included free breakfast and complimentary parking. The property was well located within easy driving range to the Orlando theme parks and within an easy drive to a huge range of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable & Quiet”
Reviews.Author: cadetdig
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights for a convention and was pleasantly pleased with the comfort and ease of the stay...s.taff were delightful and it was very clean and convenient in all ways...came with a fairly good breakfast...all was good except the toaster took forever and the eggs seemed like there was a bit of water added to stretch them but otherwise was really good...we had a suite on the bottom floor ... only expected that a suite would have utensils so we had to get our own....beds really comfortable though!

Reviews.Title: “The Service was The BEST !!!!”
Reviews.Author: ReadytoGoNyc
Reviews.Content: My sweetheart and myself arrived driving from NYC to find some unknown reason our reservation was cancelled ! We was in shock, not angry...maybe too bloody tired to feel anything!!! To our delight, a lovely European GENTLEMAN - took care of us... He felt our pain..reserved a room ....fed us...just really took care of the mishap! The manager, front desk and kitchen staff...very personal and caring. I wish I could remember the very classy British fellow but he was just splendid. The hotel offers free breakfast..very good, close to everything Orlando has to offer. The beds...heavenly...Everything...will be back SOON!!

Reviews.Title: “it was as we expected”
Reviews.Author: orisheffer
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in a good location, and close to all the major atractions. in the hotel details they writes that there is a shuttle to most of the parks, in reality there is only a shuttle to Epcot, we cost us more because we needed a texi.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel for visiting Disney”
Reviews.Author: ibeplato
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights here using mileage points. It's your basic Hampton Inn, good size clean room, complimentary WiFi & breakfast buffet. Beds were very comfortable, noise was low despite being full. The staff was very helpful/friendly and was able to move our room after a booking snafu put us into a smoking room. There are lots of restaurants/shopping nearby, including a Walmart and Publix. A good value for those visiting Disney on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a great price”
Reviews.Author: dmspeech
Reviews.Content: Had a great visit at this hotel. The hotel was spotless and the rooms were spacious and beautifully decorated. This hotel was also green. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “convenient”
Reviews.Author: explorerfun
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel to bookend our stay at Disney World. (we stayed before and after the hotel on WDW property) It was a great location -- close to WDW and to the airport. The staff was wonderful. Our room was great. And breakfast was good, as expected. It was quiet and restful. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Disney Resort Alternative”
Reviews.Author: momma92
Reviews.Content: We recently took a trip to Disney World, and did a lot of comparing between Disney Resort lodging, and local (Non Disney) lodging. We decided we could not justify the cost difference, so we decided to go the Non Disney Route, and we were very happy with our decision. We would reccommed this hotel to any family traveling to Disney, or other Orlando destinations.

Reviews.Title: “I left after one night”
Reviews.Author: 57Lulu
Reviews.Content: Was supposed to stay 2 nights but left after the first due to the noise. In fairness my hotel reservation was off by one day. Since I'm Hilton Gold they accomodated me. My room was small, old and needed updating but that's not my issue. There was a bus of tourists checking in at the front desk with only one staff member checking in, answering the phone and guests questions as well as taking reservations. After 45 minutes, I able to check in. However, they also had a group of teenage boys staying there who ran up and down the halls and were loud and noist until 3:45 am. Obviously the night clerk could not control the situation to arrange for all of the guests comfort. Be aware that groups stay here and it could be loud. For business needs, stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & great price”
Reviews.Author: uccats97
Reviews.Content: My family of 6 stayed at this hotel for 4 nights while vacationing at Walt Disney World. The room we had was a 2 queen bed with sleeper sofa suite. It was very clean. The only problem we had was the sofa bed was missing several springs that held the mesh to the metal frame, so the mattress was saggy. The hotel staff took care of the issue and were friendly when doing so. The breakfast was nice every morning and typical of all Hampton's we have ever stayed at. The best perk of staying here was the location. We were literally around the corner from the Disney Maingate. I think it was a 1.5 mile drive to the light where you made a left, then 2 or 3 miles with no additional lights until the maingate! Absolutely no traffic issues any time of the day and we were coming and going at all hours. Staying here saved us $150 a night vs the cheapest WDW resorts and gave us a free breakfast everyday! What a great deal! There is also a huge Walmart around the corner with an unbelievable selection of Disney merchandise. They had the same t-shirts at Walmart for $11 that were $20 in the theme parks! There are also outlet malls very close by but we did not shop at them. All fast food restaurants were very close too. The only negative thing I have to say about this hotel was that the water temperature in the pool was 104 degrees! Way too hot on a 100 degree day. The hot tub was 106. It is not refreshing to swim in hot water. We only swam for about 15 min total. It was so hot that week that cool water was a necessity. We went to Blizzard Beach instead!

Reviews.Title: “I'll stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: TheBigDaddy
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here for 2 nights however, during our second day the staff wanted to make sure that we had a clean room. (we were rained in) Everything we asked for was attended promptly and witnessing the staff tend to the customers was incredible. This Hampton does not have beginners working here. Everyone is professional. That is a nice feature.

Reviews.Title: “Super price and nice facility. I would recommend it to Disney goers.”
Reviews.Author: Bucklebear
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at Hampton Inns and have fairly consistent luck. Of course, some are nicer than others (the one on Walden Blvd. in Buffalo, NY is practically a boutique hotel) and this one I would rate at only one step below that, my H.I. pinnacle. Beds are comfortable, although the décor seemed a bit dated. It was clean, and the staff was very friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was decent. Definitely up to standards and the price was excellent. We all enjoyed the outdoor pool and whirlpool.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay away from the husle and bustle of Disney”
Reviews.Author: jaysfan21
Reviews.Content: This hotel is your typical newer build Hampton Inn so everything looks pretty new. The location of the hotel is kind of off in the cut and away from the hustle and bustle of Disney. Both check-in and check-out went perfect without problem. The hotel has an decent size outdoor pool and business center, the latter which we did not use. There is also complimentary high speed internet which worked very well for us. The room was very clean and we did not see any issue there. My only gripe is that management did not anticipate that a high school marching band staying at the hotel would nearly clean out the breakfast. By the time my family and I made it to breakfast (with nearly 2 hours left) everything had been cleaned out and there was nothing to replace it with. The two breakfast employees did their best with what they had. This is what separates the hotel from an excellent and a very good rating. Overall I would recommend the hotel to anyone in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel- Good Location!”
Reviews.Author: wrenster7
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. We had a King suite with my two boys and my husband. Very nice accommodation, close to whatever you needed. We would definitely stay here again !

Reviews.Title: “Was okay, but not the best Hampton Inn we've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Deb62862
Reviews.Content: Our party of three adults spent one night here. We had driven all day from Memphis to the Orlando area and were looking for a place to sleep before checking in to a Disney property the next morning. We arrived about 10 p.m. Check in was fine, but there weren't any luggage carts. The desk clerk said folks take them to their rooms and don't return them. After looking on a couple of floors near the elevators we gave up and just lugged our stuff to the room by hand. The room was fine. Its not the cleanest Hampton Inn we've stayed in, but it certainly wasn't the worst. The beds were comfy and we were dead tired and slept well. There seemed to be a group of teens staying at the hotel and I was somewhat concerned about noise in the halls at night, but there was no problem. Breakfast the next day was about as expected. The man working the breakfast area was very friendly and helpful. With a couple of luggage carts sitting by the front door, we grabbed one, gathered our stuff and moved on to WDW. Check out was fine as well. The pool looked fine, but we weren't there long enough to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Was Great.”
Reviews.Author: EagerToTravel1181
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Hampton Inn several times in the past with no complaints in the past. I have not stayed here in about a year, but when I was told I would be traveling to the Kissimmee area for work, there was no other place I would rather stay...based on past experience. However, this hotel has lost some of it's appeal. I will say that for the most part and for the money, this is a standard hotel. In the past I have always held Hampton's in high regard and actively search for Hamptons when I am traveling for work. The Good: Friendly Check-in - People at the desk are polite. Location Nice breakfast - to include fresh fruit and warm eggs and sausage - also the standard continental trimmings The Bad: Uncomfortable bed - I have never stayed at a Hampton Inn that had and uncomfortable bed...until now...the bed in my room has seen better days...lumpy and saggy. Cleaning Service - did not bother to put the iron board back in the closet and (while my fault) the iron was left plugged in all day...dirty coffee cup in coffee maker - I had made a second cup of coffee in my room but ran out of time to drink it...the cleaning service did replinish my coffee suply, but left a cup of coffee in the coffee maker right next to the basket. Furnishing - The desk chair has several rips and tears that are uncomfortable. Fidge cabinet has several scrapes and "dings" in it. Overall: I can honestly say that the hotel is quiet and work can be accomplished in the evening hours, but the bed and desk are major drawbacks to the hotel. The cleaning service was not the greatest in the world either. I would recommed this hotel to someone who was looking for a low cost room and quiet, but in the past I would have rated this hotel much higher.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet hotel with great beds”
Reviews.Author: AstridSch
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my daughter of 10 for 5 nights. The room was clean and well equipped with fridge and coffeemaker and a nice big TV. For me the most important things of a hotel are: 1. the bed, 2. the bathroom and 3. quietness, which were all three met with perfection. Especially the comfy king bed. I slept in it like a queen! The shower was awesome as well and you could not hear a sound from neighbor rooms which was very relaxing. A good breakfast was served every morning starting 6am, we mostly took it up to the room as the breakfast area was quite crowdy, especially on the weekend. There's just one thing I did not like about it: they serve it on foam plates and you eat with plastic cuttlery, negative for such a hotel that on top claims to be environmentally friendly!! The whole staff was very friendly and helpful at all times. We did not have a rental car, so the free shuttle to Disney World was very convenient as taxis cost so much in the States. However, if you want to visit other attractions, such as Sea World or Universal Studios you rather want to have a car, because they are really far out and you have to pay min. $30 for a cab. Taxi to the airport is around $50. There's a nice mall (Factory Stores) only 20 minutes walk from the hotel and Walmart is around the corner, if you need to shop. We never got enough time to use the pool or jacuzzi, but they both looked nice and clean. My over all opinion of this hotel is very positive and I would definitely recommend it to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Summerbabe1980
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 3 nights at the Hampton Suites, and was happy with my choice of hotel. Good value for money, free parking, WIFI, buffet breakfast, use of gym and pool. We have usually had to pay a separate resort fee for all of the above so we were pleased. Good customer service, very welcoming and always keen to help. Rooms were ok nothing amazing, but clean and beds comfy. We had a microwave and fridge which was very useful. Bad points (nothing too serious) - funny smell in bathroom from the water - location wasn't fantastic for us, as had to drive in evening to get to a restaurant. Parks were all within a 15 min drive, no complaint there bur due to our short stay it would have been nice to be able to walk to a restaurant / bar. Definitely would recommend hotel though especially for families visiting park. Pool open late in eve so good for kids to have a splash around in.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location”
Reviews.Author: MCCleveland
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location, close to restaurants, shopping and Disney. The room and bed were huge, comfortable and clean. Breakfast was good. Staff was friendly. We would definitely stay here again next time we go to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Always like Hampton Inn but exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: jcseagull
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit for work and try to stay at Hampton Inns because I find them to be clean, quiet ( for the most part ) with a decent breakfast and friendly staff. When we decided to visit Universal Studios, I booked a room at the Hampton Inn in Kissimmee. Upon arrival, the single clerk behind the desk was trying to help a woman with no reservation find an available hotel. The clerk, Nicole, had tried 5 other hotels without finding anything. While Nicole was helping this woman, another clerk who apparently hadn't clocked in yet, saw we had been waiting and registered us quickly. Our room was clean and spacious with 2 queen beds and a pull out couch. The pool is larger than any other of the Hamptons I've staid at and they also have a outdoor hot tub that was enjoyable. The only downside ( minor for us ) was the internet was fairly slow. We interacted with the staff on a couple of ocassions and they were very helpful, even to the point of bringing us towels to our room when we skipped the standard cleaning. Breakfast options are fairly large and the staff kept the food well stocked. This is a very busy location, as it's not far from Disney and Universal and yet the staff kept the place humming and clean. A very pleasant stay that exceeded my normal high expectations for Hampton.

Reviews.Title: “Best night of the business trip!”
Reviews.Author: SusieLikes2Travel
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel! Staff was very friendly and willing to assist in any way possible. The room was HUGE and very clean! I was next to the elevator, so I was worried that it might be noisy, but it wasn't at all. The bed was heavenly and I slept like a rock! A tad pricey, but the quality made it worth the extra money! LOVED the free wifi!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, decent breakfast, near everything.”
Reviews.Author: Renat0122
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our stay here. The room was CLEAN. I am picky about cleanliness in hotels, and I had NO problems here. The bed was comfy, but I was concerned about the sofa sleeper after reading reviews. The hotel said they were aware of complaints for the sofas so they put more padding in them. Well, I didn't see any additional padding, and the springs ARE felt, but luckily I had two kids who were 60 and 40 pounds sleep in them, and it was completely fine for them. They didn't complain and slept soundly. I personally would have been uncomfortable, but for kids who are too light to really notice -- it's fine. It is near a highway, but we asked for a room on the other side and not near elevators or ice machines. We even asked for a room near a vacant room. It was quiet. There are always inconsiderate people who talk loudly at night or let their doors slam shut early in the morning, but that is to be found even in the finer hotels. It is a hop, skip and a jump to Irlo Bronson Highway where many shops and restaurants are, and the ride to the parks are about 10 mins. The front desk said they were about 3.5 miles from the parks. I would stay here again mainly for the cleanliness. That's always my main concern staying at hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: STRDAK
Reviews.Content: This motel was amazing. Very clean. Courteous staff. Great location with restaurants and attractions very close. Huge rooms. Great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: raccardani
Reviews.Content: I stayed here overnight with my family and after a long cold night at Disney we finally arrived and were greeted by Raphael who was as sweet as could be. We were also pleasantly surprised by the clean spacious room we recieved. This was one of the cleanest hotels we have stayed in a long time and we have traveled quite a bit this year. I would surely reccommend this property to anyone. Keep up the good work and look forward to staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever! Highly reccommend”
Reviews.Author: Martyn321
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two weeks. We booked this hotel because of the great price. Let me tell you - once we arrived and checked into our room we where completely blown away! The photos on there web site do not do it justice. the room was enormous, in 100% great condition and was all so clean. No noise from other visitors, the breakfast buffet was great - though one slght niggle, was when the male attendant was supervising the breakfast area, he did not keep all the items stocked up, and there didnt seem to be as much variety as when the female attendant was there. I would and have recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to sports fields, not really quiet”
Reviews.Author: solarstar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a sports team, and found teams from several different sports were also staying here since it is very convenient to the local fields. The hotel was clean, and the breakfast area had a large seating area (which was usually pretty full). Our room overlooked the pool, so we could hear one team with their late-night party pretty clearly in our room. Sounds from the hallway were also pretty loud in the room, so if you're a light sleeper this may not be the place for you. Otherwise, it was a good place to stay for tournaments and the location was within a short driving distance of many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jdwalshGrandFalls_Nl
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very pleasureable. Upon arriiving late night we were immediately, upon request, upgraded to a queen suite room without charge. Our room was 109 directly across from the breakfast bar. The breakfast each morning consisted of a hot delight, including ham and eggs, etc lots of fresh fruit, cereals (hot and cold), various juices,yogourt, various breads and muffins. Our room was in excellent condition and extremely clean and spacious. We were told the hotel was just 2 years old. Staff were extremely pleasant and helpful and could call us by name. We stayed there 5 nights and would definately stay again. If you need to take an early flight before the breakfast area opens the staff have breakfast on the go bags on the counter for you to take with you.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Skidders86
Reviews.Content: We stayed here hilt visiting the theme parks in Orlando. The hotel is far away from International Drive to escape the crowds, but is still only a short drive from Seaworld etc. Very good value for money, and includes free breakfast. Rooms were spacious and clean, and the hotel was quiet and relaxed. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Below average Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: SPman00
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night stopping over for business and the Hampton Inn was below my expectations. The night clerk at check in was extremely pleasant, but the stay really went down hill from there. The room A/C unit wasn't running at all before I got into the room and it took hours to take the humidity out, leading to a rough sleep. The breakfast was adequate, but didn't have the selection I usually see at the Hampton Inns, which is surprising with the number of families that were staying here. It was okay, but I'd probably stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: sncbaker
Reviews.Content: We had a very good experience staying for the first time here, the service was spot on. We needed pillows changing because they were feather and they were changed straight away, no hassle, everybody was extremely friendly. When we asked for hot water late at night for a cup of tea the staff got it straight away. The beds were made daily and there was always plenty of towels. The pool was lovely and warm and there was always towels to use for the pool. I do agree with other peoples comments about the need to change the colour of the rooms but this isnt a complaint. We were very close to all the disney parks and universal, and to the florida mall and the mall at millenia, there were lots of outlets near by too so plenty of stuff to do. The things we liked best were the very helpful staff who went out of their way to make our stay as hassle free as it was, they are a credit to the hapmtons.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, very clean, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: RustyDog2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2010 for a 3 night stay leading up to a cruise we were taking. The room we had was wonderful. It was a King studio w/ sofa bed. We were amazed at the size of this room. It had everything we needed, nice modern LCD TV, refrigerator, microwave and separate bar/sink area. The bed was amazingly comfortable. The breakfast area was very clean and the food was plentiful and hot. The pool was nice and the location of the hotel was perfect. Not close to all the hustle and bustle of Disney yet only minutes away on SR535. We will definitely stay here again. This place was perfect. The cost of the room was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel with very helpful and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Snorky5
Reviews.Content: Typical Hampton Inn in my experience. The difference was how very friendly all the staff were, they seemed to enjoy thier work and nothing was too much trouble. All really pleasant. Well done, no hesitation about returning here.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad- here are some useful things to know:”
Reviews.Author: TripFan07
Reviews.Content: The Room: It was an alright stay. I don't recommend getting the king bed and sofa bed room if someone is going to be sleeping on the sofa bed. I also slept on the king bed for a few nights which was wonderfully firm and comfy- I wish I could take it home! The sofa bed, on the other hand, had a mattress so thin that I could feel the metal springs digging into my back. Sleeping on the floor was considered. We complained about it. The person at the reception desk said they’ll “see what they can do” which is apparently nothing, so later in the day we asked again to a different person and someone brought up some blankets up to our room to put as padding. It helped a little. The hotel isn’t the cleanest in the word, but it’s clean enough (maybe my expectations were too high after reading the reviews). There are signs of being old such as a little dirt along the edges of the wall and tiny orange specks from being washed too much, but that’s normal for its age and overall it’s clean. The room service was adequate- they brought in new towels, made the bed, etc. There were some nice free features in the room such as a microwave, fridge, flat screen TV, coffee maker, rectangular shower with adjustable shower head, internet in room, table, a leather chair and a regular chair. The Location: It’s located right next to a busy freeway with fast cars. Maybe we weren’t used to the traffic in Florida, but be careful of making U turns. There is a large center grassy lane in the middle and to turn in or make a U turn, you have to look for the openings. It’s definitely a tourist spot, so a lot of places to shop and eat. Be careful of the stores with large signs saying they sell theme park tickets. There are a lot of random small shops there that I can’t pronounce the names of. Some people are also selling fruit and hats along the road. There’s a Walmart about a 4 minute walk (do not recommend walking! There is no sidewalk and the cars are fast) and a 2 minute drive from the Hampton (you have to drive down a road and them make a U turn since it’s on the same side of the street as the Hampton Inn hotel). We went there quite often, so it was pretty useful. There’s also a nice chicken store that sells up to whole chicken for a good deal adjacent to that area. The free breakfast: The breakfast is pretty good and the cooking staff friendly and helpful. There is a large variety, unlike what I saw was at the hotel next door. Breakfast is from 6-10. I don’t know why someone said from 8-9 because it isn’t when I was there. I advise going before 8 to beat the large crowd. There is a section that has a different kind of “egg” or random type of food every day. The first day it was an omelet and sausages, then scrambled eggs and a different kind of sausage, then French toast, etc. Also available everyday are cereal (when I came frosted flakes, cheerios, and raisin brain), muffins, bagels, slices of bread, English muffin, waffles (you cook yourself), mixed fruit, yoghurt, and pastries. There are also condiments such as honey, peanut butter, jelly, syrup. The drinks I can remember are coffee, hot chocolate, orange juice, low fat and 2% milk. Disney World and Tickets: There is a shuttle that brings people from Hampton Inn to Epcot leaving at 8:45am and 10:55am and leaving from Epcot at 6:30pm, 8:45pm, and 10:30pm. We drove so we didn’t use it. Tickets are sold next door at the Calypso Cay Hotel (same place we saw the breakfast). They sell tickets for a lot of places including Universal Studios. One of the catches is if you’re buying a one day ticket, say for a Disney World park, then there is an added fee (I think around $4?). There are also some nice maps at the park at the desk where they sell the tickets. The drive to Disney World isn’t that far- about 5 minutes. Random: The water in the hotel (sinks, shower, water fountains) smells and tastes like chemicals. Ugh! I had to use bottled water to brush my teeth. I know it’s not the water in Florida because I tasted the fountains at the other resorts around Disney World and they taste fresh. The ice from the ice maker tastes alright though. I saw some baked cookies (oatmeal raisin and chocolate chip) two out of the eight days we were there. I think it was because we were coming late. They’re probably gone by 5:30. They have to check your room at least every two days or something. We had the suspicion that someone may have come in during the day even though we put the do not disturb sign up since the air conditioner was turned off. Nothing was disturbed or missing though. We could hear some kids running down the hall one night, but it was quiet overall. We were on the 5th floor overlooking the swimming pool. Even though it’s usually crowded, we didn’t hear anything which was nice. We also had neighbors next door, but we could not hear them either. There’s a fitness center and pool but we didn’t use them. Oh, and there's free parking. Overall, it was a pleasant enough stay for the long stay- nothing to be super glad about, but not too much to complain either. I would consider staying again if it wasn’t a sofa bed room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, kind staff who went beyond”
Reviews.Author: kassy55
Reviews.Content: I found the Hampton Inn for my daughter to stay for a month while she studied nearby and stayed several nights myself. The room was beautiful, and laid out well for a long term stay. All the amenities--pool, fitness center, and breakfast--were excellent quality. The best part of the hotel was the wonderful staff. They brought my homesick daughter a cake on her birthday, made every effort to get to know her, made sure she got in safely every night after class, and did everything they could to make her stay comfortable and fun. I can not say enough about how kind and helpful every single staff member was--from the folks at the desk to the housekeeping staff. Thank you all, and we'll see you next summer for 5 more weeks!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Chevy10_10
Reviews.Content: We stood for 9 nights and this hotel is unbeatable. Clean, spacious, well appointed and very good located. It's hard to find something like this value. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, great value, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: cliza
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel! great value for the money and the location can be beat. The rooms are very spacious, the bed is very comfortable and having the mini fridge with the microwave was a great amenity to have as you can just save food for later. The breakfast was really good although from 8-9 am it was the busiest time to go have some so you should plan accordingly to eat before so you dont have to wait in the long lines. Overall excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: cmcarman
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic hotel to stay in. Kissimmee is full of flashy and cheap hotels and it was very difficult to find a nice hotel for a good price in a central location. I am a young, solo traveler and I was able to negotiate a fair price for a suite and stayed at this hotel for a month. The hotel itself is very safe and the environment felt secure. The hotel is close to everything in Kissimmee and Celebration and only about 20 minutes from the airport. The employees are wonderful and friendly. They even brought me a birthday cake on my birthday. The gym is excellent, the breakfast is very good, and they have a free printer/business center. I really enjoyed this hotel and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gfree123
Reviews.Content: Very clean, very comfortable, very nice!! Wonderful hot breakfast! Loved this hotel and would DEFINITELY stay again and recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn does it right.”
Reviews.Author: Richie61
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel. Only ten minutes to Disney Parks with free shuttle to Epcot and then to all others from there. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying near Disney. Wonderful staff, greatly equipped room and bathroom, good hot breakfast. Would stay here every time I went to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with courteous staff.”
Reviews.Author: dtaylor0053
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one night. Checked in and asked for a free room upgrade and got it! Room was clean, pool area was clean. Kids had a good time playing in the pool and hot tub. Next morning the battery in our van was dead so needed a jump start. Lady a front desk was very helpful. She had jumper cables in her car and let us use them to jump the van with assistance from another guest. The breakfast was good. Eggs and bacon were fresh and hot. Fruit was fresh and the breakfast area was clean and uncrowded. In all it was a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: CaraUK
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful check in. Room was great with an enormous and very comfortable bed, desk & sofa. The bathroom was also very large. Excellent breakfast served in a nice lounge type room. The coffee is available 24 hours so you can sit in the lounge with a coffee and chat with friends. The only slight downside to the hotel is that the pool is on the side of the hotel with no sun so is probably only used in the summer. The hot tub was hot though and several people were using it. There is also a fitness room and although we didn't use it, it did look nice. Wireless and wired internet access in the room worked without problem and there is also a computer in the lounge which guests can use.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: StarA00
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and great. The shower wasn't the best but it wasn't bad. The shuttle service to EPCOT was great but they do pick up other hotels too. Getting free wireless and breakfast is always a plus. I always leave the housekeepers a tip. I found a nice surpise of popcorn and a towel animal in return. Maybe they do that for everyone, either was it was nice. Hampton Inn, I have found to be a great hotel chain all around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: parilla
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean with friendly and helpful staff. Breakfasts have good variety. Hot foods plus baked goods, yogurt and fresh fruit. The hotel is well located just off the highway and easy to find. A short drive to good restaurants, Downtown Disney and outlet shopping till you drop. As mentioned in other reviews, they have a shuttle bus to and from Epcot that leaves at different times throughout the morning returning in the evening. David on the front desk is most helpful if you need recommendations for dining. Nicole went out of her way to make sure we had a good Disney experience. I would recommend this hotel completely.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Excellent”
Reviews.Author: jrlpianoman
Reviews.Content: I don't think there is anything that could make this motel any better. This is the second Hampton Inn that we have stayed in and we are extremely impressed with this company. The facility is completely and extremely clean - whether you are in the lobby, the lobby washroom or your room. There is a complimentary shuttle to Epcot, from which you can catch a bus or monorail to the other parks (saves $14 for parking). Disney and other local attraction tickets can be purchased in the building next door - just ask the front desk where to go. Breakfast is excellent with decent selection. If there was anything that I could pick on, it would be that the walls are a little thin - but this is very minor. We would definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Just Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: Sildani
Reviews.Content: Stayed a late January weekend to enjoy a quick Disney getaway with my wife. Chose this hotel because of its high guest rating in hotels.com and the special low rate. It's situated just north of US-192, close to the Disney Resort. Virtually a five-minute drive to Epcot Center, and perhaps a bit more to the other parks. Located on a quieter part of Lake Buena Vista, I had to drive a bit to find good area restaurants (keep going north on 535 to get to Lake Buena Vista's center and find nice shops and eateries, not to mention Downtown Disney). The hotel grounds, lobby and room were clean. The hotel room itself was an interesting mix of new and old; the wallpaper and carpet were dated, while the furnishings and flat-screen (but not HD) TV were relatively new. No bath tub, just a shower, but the bathroom was a good size, with a large vanity area. The beds felt older, too. Very soft and worn-out mattress, with even softer and worn-out pillows. Your mileage may vary, of course, but I was expecting slightly higher quality from the bed and pillows. The rooms also don't enclose sound too well; my neighbor's singing was clearly heard Saturday morning, albeit around 9AM. (We were already up by then.) If you value being shielded from others, or ensuring you are shielded yourself, this may not be the hotel for you. Customer service was pretty non-existant. At one point I phoned "housekeeping" (this was around 8PM on a Saturday night) to ask for firmer pillows (they advertised firm pillows were available in the room) but was placed on hold for about 10 minutes before I decided to hang up and just go downstairs. I needed a shower cap anyway for my wife (they similarly advertised they had this and other toiletries upon request), which required a trip downstairs. I had to make the line, as there was only one worker, and once it was my turn the front desk person responded that they had neither firmer pillows or shower caps, despite the advertisements in the rooms. To her credit, she wasn't rude, but it was annoying to be troubled for what ended up being nothing. I'm not a fan of false advertisement. They serve hot breakfast in the morning, including eggs, sausage and french toast sticks. They also have fresh fruit, yogurt and a selection of teas and coffees (decaf, regular, dark), so if you're healthy conscious like my wife and I, this will be satisfactory. Lots of hotels offer something like this, so I wouldn't make a decision based on this alone. It's here if you want it, though. Conclusion: If all you want is a clean room with adequate bed on a quieter part of Orlando close to Disney by car, you may be happy here. If you want more, notably good customer service, you're better off trying your luck somewhere else. With all the choices available in the area, I won't be coming back here any time soon.

Reviews.Title: “" Wonderful, can't wait to visit again"”
Reviews.Author: gerynjorge
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 and last week we traveled with our friends to Disney for the long weekend. We stayed at this hotel and it was absolutely wonderful. Check in went smoothly (very important after a long day of driving), our room was great, very spacious, nicely updated and best of all...very clean! The complimentary breakfast every morning is great, we would get up early, eat and then leave to the parks; we couldn't have asked for a better hotel stay. The staff was also very friendly and helpful, I can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay but”
Reviews.Author: be4minn
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at this hotel. THe added extras were great: Spa, pool, exercise room, towels poolside, Internet connection and printer, mulitiple choices with hot/cold breakfast, friendly staff. Great beds with down comforters, large TV, refrig and microwave in every room, good location . OVERALL wondeful place to stay. We did have 2 small problems. Two friendly roaches after we eat taco supper in the room which were sprayed by staff without further reoccurance and second being a small cookie on the floor near the window when we arrived. Rooms were clean, free of ordors, but Housekeeping needs to fine tune their services. We would surely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Free breakfast and free shuttle to Disney World”
Reviews.Author: 1TS
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful during my 11 night stay. There was a problem with the internet in my room which couldn't be fixed until the next day so a couple of the staff members helped me move into another room. Free breakfast (breakfast-to-go for business travelers) and free shuttle to Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nwhiteiii
Reviews.Content: My wofe and i stayed a this hotel which is a few miles from disney and a few miles from the Outlets. Price was reasinable and the room was clean. The hotel staff were very friendly and the free breakfast was not bad either. We will stay here the next time we are in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Disney - Clean & Great Price”
Reviews.Author: ACINDY
Reviews.Content: With a family of 5, it's hard to find a decent size room at a reasonable price if you stay at a Disney property hotel. So, we chose to stay at this Hampton Inn for our Disney trip. The hotel is located just a few miles from the Disney theme parks. We stayed in a studio suite (two queen beds + a pull out couch). The accomodations were roomy, clean and you couldn't beat the price!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hampton Inn = wonderful stay........”
Reviews.Author: abcjjl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights Friday 8/21/09 - Sunday 8/23/09. 2 adults and 3 boys 6, 9, 12. This was the 1st leg of a 2 part stay. 2 nights here, hitting Typhoon Lagoon all day on Saturday, checking out early on Sunday and heading to Universal's Portofino Bay Resort for 6 nights. We arrived around 6:00 pm from an all day drive down from Easley, SC. Room was ready so we located a luggage cart near the lobby and got settled into our room. We had a king room on the 4th floor away from the elevators per our usual request. This property is very, very nice. Room was overly large with a counter/sink area with a nice mirror above on the left after entering the room with a small fridge and a microwave located below. Sleeper sofa in very good shape, a couple of tables, along with a desk and chair for work fit with plenty of room to spare. Nice flat-screen TV located in the middle of the room with capability to rotate the screen for couch or bed viewing. On the far side of the room was the king bed with 2 night stands. The bath area had a large counter with one sink. (we utilized the other sink around the corner of the room for the kids to brush their teeth, etc.) The bathroom was a decent size with a great tub/shower combo.....being 6'3", the shower was located high on the wall and was wonderful. The carpets were in great shape and everything was very clean. The room had 2 large windows, one along side the bed and one at the end of the sofa. Finally, the ac/heating unit was wall controlled and very quiet. The property was not very crowded at all. The breakfast area was immaculately clean and had plenty of food choices both mornings. The front desk staff was very efficient. We had no issues of any kind so our contact with them was minimal. Maid service was good. The pool area and pool, which we did not use, is on the smallish side and that could be an issue when the place was busy. We would definitely stay here again if it fit the needs of our stay. This is a great hotel and one of the best parts was that the room was only $66 a night plus tax for a non-cancellation type room rate over the internet about 3 months prior to our arrival. Again, our trip was during a very slow time for the Orlando area. Lastly, I saw where another poster mentioned that they did not have the cookies in the evening that many Hampton properties provide. They had cookies when we arrived on Friday evening.....our kids think that is so cool.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: RnD75
Reviews.Content: Wonderful accomodations! Very clean! Very Quiet! Very close to Disney attractions, a variety of restaurants and International Drive. Our 2 queen bed suite was much more than we had expected at $85/night. The frig and micro with counter was very adequate. The sitting area with computer desk, sofa, chairs and coffee table was ver large. It was also very convenient to have the bathroom sink separated from the tub/commode area, so two people could get ready with no waiting. Breakfast offered quite a variety with fresh fruit, cereals, bagels, rolls, breads, a different "hot" choice daily, juices, milk, coffee - ALL VERY GOOD. We woudl highly recomment this Hampton Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Facilities, Mediocre Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: gatorcard83
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hampton Inn and Suites in Kissimmee, Florida from July 19th to July 23rd. Overall the stay went very well and for the most part everything was exemplary. Check in was nice and smooth, no issue with the rates or room at all. All of the room keys worked, which isn't always a guarantee either, and we were able to go to our room at noon. The room itself is nice and spacious, the beds were typical Hampton, which are some of the best in the world in terms of hotel quality. The room was modern and had a very nice desk area and a nice flat screen TV. Bathroom area was very nice with a lot of towels to use and enough toiletries for two people, they didn't skimp like some other hotels tend to do. The only negative about the room was the green color they had on the wall, it just didn't fit and made the room seem a little off. I prefer a more traditional/warmer color in my room. The facilities around the hotel were excellent, the outdoor pool was one of the warmest I have ever experienced, which was really nice. The hot tub area was very nice and the fitness center was unique in that each of the cardio machines had individual TV's and headphones, a nice touch. The only aspect about the hotel that I though was below average for a Hampton was the breakfast. It is a busy hotel but I still thought the breakfast person was getting food out in a rather slow manner. The breakfast also lacked some of the fruit offerings that I enjoy in other Hamptons. The breakfast was still good and the breakfast area itself is nice, but I thought the breakfast food selection could have been a lot better. The location for the hotel is very convenient, about 10 minutes from Disney and close (but not on, which is very nice) to 192. The hotel is next to the Osceola Parkway, which offers a direct road to Disney and I-4, but it is a toll road (75 cents I believe each way, exact change). You can take 192 which is not a toll road, but with the lights it adds an extra 10 minutes to get to Disney and I-4. Lots of restaurants in the area though and a Wal-Mart Supercenter within walking distance. Overall the stay was excellent, I would only recommend to the hotel changing the wall color and improving the breakfast. Great location though, nice facilities, great rooms, and a lot of times some very good rates (we paid $69/night). I would recommend this hotel to anyone in the Central Florida area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: spundtucker
Reviews.Content: Close to all attractions in quiet area very elegant after long day of travel this was a gem to 'come home to' Restaurants are close but not to be walked to Out of the way of heavy business traffic on highway In resort area that was beautiful There were several teen bus groups at hotel during stay and we never even knew they were there Breakfast was wonderful Staff was more then helpful at all hours Pool was wonderful and suite was one of Hampton's best I ever stayed in

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again but a few complaints.”
Reviews.Author: usadan
Reviews.Content: The bedding is very comfortable. Slept very well. Rooms are clean. Jacuzzi is nice. I was disappointed that the standard rooms have a shower only--not tubs. Upgraded to a suite which has a tub (and fridge and microwave) for $10 more per night. All rooms are painted GREEN. I prefer a warmer color for rooms and never got used to the green walls in the room. Other Hampton Inns have much nicer decor. There were no bananas at breakfast Monday morning :( Didn't notice any warm cookies in the afternoon like at other Hampton Inns. Fitness center is cardio only, no weights. Still, overall, would stay again for the cleanliness and nice bedding.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was very helpful and rooms nice”
Reviews.Author: Lene65
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. The staff is great especially, Dave the night auditor and front desk person. He was very helpful with a problem we had with our room and he was knowledgeable on information about Disney. The hotel was clean, comfortable and had a pleasant décor. The breakfast in the morning had a wide selection of items to choose from and was very filling. The hotel is a great value for your dollar.

HotelInfo.Name: Hampton Inn & Suites Orlando - South Lake Buena Vista
HotelInfo.Address: 4971 Calypso Cay Way, Kissimmee, FL 34746
